question.text:
I. William Harvey disproved the 'good humor' hypothesis of health.
II. Health can be defined as a state of complete physical, mental, and social well-being.
III. Among non-infectious diseases, cancer is the major cause of death.
IV. Many genera like Microsporum, Trichophyton, and Epidermophyton are responsible for ringworms which is one of the most common infectious enteric diseases in man.

How many of the given statements are incorrect?

solution.text:
Ringworm is not an enteric disease, it is a fungal infection of the skin.  Enteric infection is an infection of the small intestine. Microsporum, Trichophyton, and Epidermophyton (fungi) cause ringworms (one of the most common infectious diseases in humans).

Mode of infection: Generally acquired from soil or by using towels, clothes, combs of infected individuals.

Sign and symptoms: Dry, scaly lesions on various parts of the body- skin, nails, and scalp, intense itching, etc.

Heat and moisture promote the growth of fungi. These fungi grow in skin folds in the groin or between the toes.
